summary.text: Amends the Rules of the House of Representatives to permit the employing office of any employee who serves on active duty (other than for training) as a member of the reserves with respect to any pay period during the 108th Congress to pay additional compensation to the employee for that pay period, as long as the additional compensation does not exceed the difference between the amount paid to the employee by the employing office for the most recent pay period before such active duty and the amount paid to the employee as a member for that pay period.

bill.title: Amending rule XXIII of the Rules of the House of Representatives to permit the employing office of an employee of the House who serves in a reserve component of the uniformed services to pay the employee an additional salary for any period during which the employee is on active duty.

dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
